info.title: PagePixels Screenshots
info.description: Capture website screenshots with PagePixels. Simulate user actions like clicking links, logging in, or filling out forms before capturing the page. You can also render custom HTML, perfect for screenshotting emails or dynamic reports powered by API data. For localization testing or SERP validation, you can take screenshots from real geographic locations using our global residential IP proxy network.

embed_url.description: Embeddable URL for viewing the screenshot

is_browser_extension_screenshot.description: True if captured via the browser extension

screenshot_configuration_id.description: ID of the configuration used for this screenshot

direct_link.description: Direct URL to the screenshot image

direct_thumbnail_link.description: Direct URL to the thumbnail image

taken_at_timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when the screenshot was taken

taken_at.description: ISO8601 time when the screenshot was taken

ai_analyzed.description: Whether the image was analyzed with AI

ai_response.description: Response returned by the AI analysis

get.summary: Take a Screenshot of a web page
get.description: Creates an instant screenshot of a web page from a URL.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL you would like to capture. For example https://www.wikipedia.org

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: The time zone used by the website you're capturing. If not specified, GMT will be used. Use a valid ICU/IANA time zone ID (e.g., America/New_York, Europe/Paris).

parameters.name: multi_step_actions
parameters.description: Use Multi-Step Actions to complete forms, navigate to different pages, click links and buttons, and log in to websites prior to taking your screenshot. Actions are completed in order. Learn More at https://pagepixels.com/app/screenshots-api-documentation#multi-step-screenshots

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Milliseconds to wait before capturing the screenshot. Max is 20000. Useful for pages that take time to load.

parameters.name: wait_for
parameters.description: Provide a CSS selector to wait for before capturing the screenshot.

parameters.name: incremental_scroll
parameters.description: Slowly scrolls the page to trigger lazy-loaded content. May take up to 10 seconds.

parameters.name: page_width
parameters.description: The viewport width in pixels. Default is 1920px.

parameters.name: page_height
parameters.description: The viewport height in pixels. Default is 1000px.

parameters.name: fullpage
parameters.description: Capture the full scrollable page. Default captures only the visible viewport.

parameters.name: fullpage_advanced
parameters.description: Capture full page using advanced scrolling. Useful for lazy-loaded content. Takes longer than standard Full Page.

parameters.name: selectors
parameters.description: Capture only a specific part of the page by providing a CSS selector.

parameters.name: hover_on_selected
parameters.description: If a CSS selector is used, this hovers over the element before taking the screenshot.

parameters.name: image_format
parameters.description: Generate screenshots in JPEG, PNG, or WebP format.

parameters.name: quality
parameters.description: JPEG quality (1–100). Ignored if image format is PNG.

parameters.name: scale_factor
parameters.description: Scale factor for the screenshot. Set to 2 for Retina-quality images.

parameters.name: css_inject
parameters.description: Inject custom CSS into the page before capture.

parameters.name: js_inject
parameters.description: Inject custom JavaScript into the page before capture.

parameters.name: user_agent
parameters.description: Specify a User-Agent header to emulate different devices.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: Add additional HTTP headers to the request.

parameters.name: cookies
parameters.description: Add custom cookies to the request.

parameters.name: ttl
parameters.description: Time-to-live in milliseconds for cached screenshots. Set to 0 to always generate a new one.

parameters.name: accept_language
parameters.description: Ask the website to display a specific language using the Accept-Language header.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Set the browser’s latitude geolocation.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Set the browser’s longitude geolocation.

parameters.name: accuracy
parameters.description: Set the accuracy of the browser's geolocation.

parameters.name: thumb_width
parameters.description: Width of the thumbnail image in pixels.

parameters.name: thumb_height
parameters.description: Height of the thumbnail image in pixels.

parameters.name: no_ads
parameters.description: Set to true to block ads.

parameters.name: no_tracking
parameters.description: Set to true to block trackers.

parameters.name: no_cookie_banners
parameters.description: Set to true to hide cookie banners.

parameters.name: disable_js
parameters.description: Set to true to disable all JavaScript on the page.

parameters.name: disable_third_party_js
parameters.description: Set to true to discard JavaScript from third-party domains.

parameters.name: custom_title
parameters.description: Custom name or title to identify the screenshot.

parameters.name: custom_description
parameters.description: Custom note for internal use or teammates.

get.summary: Take a Screenshot of custom HTML
get.description: Create a screenshot of any custom HTML. This is Perfect for screenshotting new emails, creating custom reports, and more.

embed_url.description: Embeddable URL for viewing the screenshot

ai_response.description: Response returned by the AI analysis

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL you would like to capture. For example https://www.wikipedia.org

parameters.name: proxy_server
parameters.description: The real location you would like to take the screenshot from. This is useful for geolocation testing, getting local search and social network results, and ensuring content displays as it really appears in your preferred country, major city, or US State. Retrieve a list of valid locations here https://pagepixels.dev.com/app/screenshots-api-documentation#real-locations-get

get.summary: Take a real geolocation screenshot of a web page
get.description: Captures a screenshot from a real geolocation. Screenshots are taken through a proxy network of rotating residential IP addresses within the geographical location you specify. Choose from hundreds of countries, cities, and states from around the world.

embed_url.description: Embeddable URL for viewing the screenshot

is_browser_extension_screenshot.description: True if captured via the browser extension

screenshot_configuration_id.description: ID of the configuration used for this screenshot

direct_link.description: Direct URL to the screenshot image

direct_thumbnail_link.description: Direct URL to the thumbnail image

taken_at_timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when the screenshot was taken

taken_at.description: ISO8601 time when the screenshot was taken

ai_analyzed.description: Whether the image was analyzed with AI

ai_response.description: Response returned by the AI analysis

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL you would like to capture. For example https://www.wikipedia.org

parameters.name: ai_prompt
parameters.description: A text prompt that guides the AI in analyzing the screenshot image. This prompt should specify what information you want the AI to extract or explain, and can be up to 2000 characters in length.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: The time zone used by the website you're capturing. If not specified, GMT will be used. Use a valid ICU/IANA time zone ID (e.g., America/New_York, Europe/Paris).

parameters.name: multi_step_actions
parameters.description: Use Multi-Step Actions to complete forms, navigate to different pages, click links and buttons, and log in to websites prior to taking your screenshot. get.summary: Take a Screenshot of a web page and analyze the image with AI
get.description: Captures a web page screenshot and runs an AI visual analysis based on your prompt. Useful for extracting data, generating summaries, or querying the website’s content. No OpenAI keys or additional setup required.

get.summary: Retrieves real locations for dynamic fields
get.description: Retrieves an array of real locations for the proxy server field.
